I will continue to fight to ensure Secretary Scalia respects workers and organized labor, and I will hold him accountable when he fails to uphold that standard.

The Department of Labor’s mission is to protect American workers. DOL has jurisdiction over job training programs, combatting wage theft, and promoting workplace safety. With so many people living paycheck-to-paycheck, these issues are more important than ever.

Eugene Scalia dedicated his career to promoting corporate interests while dismantling worker protections and breaking up unions. He fought on behalf of Wall Street and corporations like Walmart. That is not the background a Secretary of Labor should have. https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/senate-poised-to-confirm-eugene-scalia-as-labor-secretary/2019/09/26/5ff2bfe2-e067-11e9-b199-f638bf2c340f_story.html …

The Trump Administration needs to step back and reevaluate their priorities. Putting our food safety system at further risk will endanger people’s lives. No amount of additional corporate profit is worth that. I urge USDA to reverse course.

Food safety advocates certainly do not believe that. But industry lobbyists have a stranglehold on USDA, and they are rushing to implement these changes despite a flawed risk assessment analysis—which is currently the subject of an active OIG audit.

Under the guise of "modernizing" hog slaughter inspections, the Trump Administration will replace government inspectors with industry employees and allow for unlimited line speeds. Who actually believes these changes will make our food more safe?

With today’s announcement, the Trump Administration has prioritized corporate, multinational meat processors’ interests over those of the American people and their families. Make no mistake: this is all about corporate profit, not food safety concerns. -Rosa https://twitter.com/POLITICOPro/status/1173985209869455360 …

Members of Congress on both sides of the aisle need to recognize the lives President Trump has put at-risk due to his dangerous policies, and we must work to protect children as we appropriate funding for @HHSGov for the next fiscal year.

To this day, President Trump has turned @HHSGov into an immigration enforcement agency. That is wrong, and it is antithetical to the mission of the Office of Refugee Resettlement, which is to place children into sponsor’s care as safely and expeditiously as possible.
Meanwhile, some facilities were allowed to waive background checks and fingerprinting requirements for the workers that were tasked with caring for these children. That is unacceptable.

.@OIGatHHS also noted that this trauma was extended as kids languished in warehouse-like facilities for months on end due to additional Trump administration policies, such as fingerprinting everyone in a sponsor’s household.

These reports reinforce what we have known for over a year: that President Trump’s family separation policy was state-sanctioned child abuse. @OIGatHHS found that separating kids from their families inflicted unspeakable trauma on them. https://twitter.com/AP/status/1169256578060623872 …
